timeline.bodyText: variable names should be in camelCase ie: archive_directory, master_swagger

timeline.bodyText: Shouldn't we break the loop at this point?
timeline.author: tgtshanika

replies.bodyText:
This check is to get the directory path inside the zip and avoid getting files instead of directories. Thus the zip always contain only one directory.
Valid input :
temp.zip --- > temp (directory)
Invalid input :
temp.zip ----> temp.yaml
replies.author: Sarangan0219

replies.bodyText:
This check is to get the directory path inside the zip and avoid getting files instead of directories. Thus the zip always contain only one directory. Thus break will be redundant
Valid input :
temp.zip --- > temp (directory)
Invalid input :
temp.zip ----> temp.yaml
replies.author: Sarangan0219

replies.bodyText:
we agreed to use the naming convention for the master swagger. Because we cannot guarantee the directory structure because helper files may contain multiple directories in same level.
So we can remove this logic.
replies.author: ruks

timeline.bodyText:
can we define another method named "validateAPIDefinitionByPath" on respective OAS parsers? Then you can call it from here.
if so you can simply return openAPIV3Parser.validateAPIDefinitionByPath(path, returnJsonContent) here.
in respective parsers, you have to implement validateAPIDefinitionByPath function with following specific logic to parser the file path. In there you can set the correct OAS model(OpenAPI or Swagger) to the APIDefinitionValidationResponse.
With that simply you can reduce the unnecessary content parsing in multiple places.
timeline.author: ruks

replies.bodyText:
What do you mean by unnecessary content parsing ?
Here are creating a parser, resolving and getting the specific parser object and converting the parser object to string. These three folds are specific for each parsers and even if we have a separate method logic the same should be done in method logic too.
replies.author: Sarangan0219

replies.bodyText:
Since are parsing file multiple times it is better to avoid unnecessary parsing. Also, it is better to separate OAS3 and OAS2 to respective classes. If we support a naming convention to identify master swagger, this can be done.
Can you please check the attached diff? OAS_Path_validation.txt
replies.author: ruks

timeline.bodyText:
you can simply list only the required file.
ex:
FilenameFilter filter = (dir, name) -> name.equalsIgnoreCase("swagger.json") || 
name.equalsIgnoreCase("swagger.yaml")
File f = new File(path);
f.list(filter); // should have yaml to json file.
timeline.author: ruks

replies.bodyText:
User can have nested directories and place the API definition inside the leaf directory. Thus when using this filter will only check the root directory and return false .We need to traverse all over the directories and validate for the master swagger
This recursive function is doing that process :
9ded714#diff-c212ee576ac1ca0476ff5f5fb61fff6cR672

replies.bodyText: As I mentioned above, we cannot use directory structure and have to stick to naming conversion.
